passages.text: Market Insights | Markets | Emerging Markets

ASIA CREDIT MARKET OVERVIEW: Primary market is confronting a supply deluge as issuers crowd the pipeline ahead of post- summer windows, yet secondary trading remains notably muted with UST closed on US holiday. In Asia, we had four issuers announcing mandates today – FUBON USD 10.25Y Tier 2 / PTTGC PerpNC5.25 & PerpNC10 / KYUSEL USD 10Y / BNKEA CNH 4NC3 Non- Pref. At opening, Taiwan lifers led the underperformance with SHIKON/NSINTW trading 1- 2 wider in street and SHIKON subsequently getting lifted by RM. On back of the new issues, PTTGC complex moved 10- 15bp tighter while TOPTB also moved in tandem, tightening 7- 10bp as of writing. In China space, BABA credit has underperformed equities where we saw limited buying in the credit curve (bonds unch on spread) despite the strong equity performance (+18%). As for Indonesia space, its underperformance post the protests started to fade into the session (earlier than expected..) where we have seen material RM demand for bonds and also selling of CDS from both macro accounts who bought on Friday and credit accounts as a position ahead of the roll. The demand for INDON cash bonds was mainly on the belly and we were 2- 3bp wider so far today (i.e., 2- 3bp tighter from the wides) while the 5y CDS topped out at 75 and got back in around 74 before lunch.

亚洲信贷市场概览：一级市场正面临供应激增的局面，发行人争相在夏季过后窗口前涌入发行管道，然而由于美国假期美债市场休市，二级市场交易依然明显低迷。亚洲方面，今日有四家发行人宣布了承销授权——FUBON美元10.25年期二级资本债/PTTGC永续NC5.25及永续NC10/KYUSEL美元10年期/BNKEA人民币4NC3非优先债。开盘时，台湾寿险公司领跌，SHIKON/NSINTW在市场上交易价差扩大1- 2个基点，随后SHIKON被零售资金买入。受新发行带动，PTTGC系列债券收窄10- 15个基点，同时TOPTB也同步收窄，截至发稿时收窄7- 10个基点。中国方面，BABA信用表现逊于股票，尽管股价表现强劲（+18%），但信用曲线上买盘有限（债券利差持平）。印尼方面，抗议活动后的表现不佳在交易时段中开始消退（比预期更早），我们看到债券有大量零售资金需求，同时宏观账户（周五买入）和信用账户在展期前均有卖出CDS的操作。对印尼现金债券的需求主要集中在中段，今天到目前为止我们走宽了2- 3个基点（即较高点收窄了2- 3个基点），而5年期CDS最高触及75，午餐前回落至约74。
All references to "we/us/our" refer to the views and observations of the desk unless otherwise specified. 除非另有说明，所有提及“我们/我方/我们的”均指交易台的观点和观察。
- Asia Weekly Themes & Risk Views亚洲每周主题与风险观点

- Asia Weekly Risk Movers  
- GS Asia Credit - Breaking Routine  
- Asia Credit Trader: De-Dollarization a Gradual Path for Asia Credit Investors; Shifting HY Preference to Greater China
[excerpt, full note here]

- Strong start to the week post Jackson Hole with Asia IG cash 1-3bps tighter, HY cash 0.25-0.75pts higher (EM HY frontiers outperforming 0.5-1pt higher) and CDS 1.5-2bps tighter. Risk felt good but there was a little less than expected client follow through as almost immediately it became evident that the primary machine would start to ramp up earlier. By mid-week, the market was working through at least 7 USD deals across Asia Pacific (including Japan) with further financial supply out of the Middle East coming at attractive spreads (e.g. Saudi Awwal Bank issuing \$1.25bn 10NC5 T2 notes at T+220bps with issue rating Baa2/BBB by Moody's/Fitch).

杰克逊霍尔会议后，本周开局强劲，亚洲投资级现金价差收窄1- 3个基点，高收益现金上涨0.25- 0.75点（新兴市场高收益前沿市场表现更佳，上涨0.5- 1点），CDS价差收窄1.5- 2个基点。风险情绪良好，但客户的后续跟进略低于预期，因为几乎立刻就显现出一级市场发行将会提前加速。到本周中，市场已在处理亚太地区（包括日本）至少7笔美元交易，中东地区的金融机构也以有吸引力的利差发行更多债券（例如，Saudi Awwal Bank发行12.5亿美元10NC5二级资本票据，利差为T+220个基点，穆迪/惠誉评级为Baa2/BBB）。

- Over the course of the next few sessions, spreads struggled to keep up with the move higher in core rates after headlines on Tuesday around Fed Governor Cook sparked a rally in front-end with the Treasury curve steepening further. The lower core yield environment that was present this week combined with a steady primary supply tape generally kept regional accounts away from doing much in secondaries – if anything there were perhaps more two-way flows in low-beta IG and duration tickers as valuations seemed to have reached a near-term upper bound.
在接下来的几个交易日中，在周二有关美联储理事 Cook 的新闻引发前端市场上涨、国债收益率曲线进一步超陡之后，利差难以跟上核心利率的上行步伐。本周较低的核心收益率环境，加上一级市场供应保持稳定，总体上使得区域账户在二级市场的操作不多——如果有的话，可能更多的是在低贝塔投资级和久期标的中出现双向交易，因为估值似乎已接近短期上限。

- Trade concerns between US/India and the subsequent impact on India credit seems to be largely limited so far based on investor conversations. Borrowing comments from Nihal Koshy on the HY trading desk; "This week saw the 50% trade tariff on India go effective at 12:01 AM EST on 27th August and there were further hawkish comments from Navarro on Wednesday correlating India's purchase of oil as a loss

to the American people. India has launched a number of countermeasures domestically to manage the GDP impact of the tariffs and has held firm to the view that the purchase of Russian oil is their right and a benefit to the Indian populace. Again, doesn't seem like there is much middle ground being formed on either side for the moment. The impact to HY- is limited outside of sentiment - and for that the Vedanta longer end is probably the best barometer of beta risk and the curve there was flat to 25c higher this week as overall sentiment was positive."

根据与投资者的交流来看美国与印度之间的贸易担忧及其对印度信贷的后续影响目前似乎仍相对有限。引用高收益交易台Nihal Koshy的评论：“本周，针对印度的 \(50\%\) 贸易关税于8月27日美国东部时间凌晨12:01正式生效，周三Navarro又发表了更为鹰派的言论，将印度购买石油与美国人民的损失联系起来。印度在国内推出了一系列应对措施，以管理关税对GDP的影响，并坚持认为购买俄罗斯石油是他们的权利，并且有利于印度民众。双方目前似乎都没有形成太多的中间立场。对高收益债的影响主要局限于情绪层面——在这方面，Vedanta的长端债券可能是衡量贝塔风险的最佳指标，本周该曲线持平至上涨25美分，整体情绪积极。”

- Interestingly, macro data released out of India this week showed Q2 real GDP growth came in significantly above expectations on the back of strong consumption and services sector growth (7.8% YoY in Q2 CY25, from 7.4% YoY in Q1 CY25) and suggests there may be ample buffer to withstand any tariff shock. Private consumption expenditure growth sharply increased to a one-year high of 7.0% YoY (+6.2% QoQ s.a.), partly reflecting a steady revival of mass consumption. Real GVA growth rose to a six-quarter high driven by the services sector – this came as a surprise given the potential impacts on tourism from airport closures due to the Pakistan/India border conflict in May. Our economists commented that given the significant upside surprise in the GDP print, they see upside risks to their real GDP growth forecast for CY25 and FY26, despite US tariff related headwinds to growth.

有趣的是，本周印度公布的宏观数据显示，第二季度实际GDP增速显著高于预期，主要得益于强劲的消费和服务业增长（2025年第二季度同比增长 \(7.8\%\) ，高于2025年第一季度的同比 \(7.4\%\) ），这表明可能有充足的缓冲来应对任何关税冲击。私人消费支出增速大幅上升至一年高点的同比 \(7.0\%\) （环比经季调 \(+6.2\%\) ），部分反映了大众消费的稳步复苏。实际GVA增速升至六个季度以来的最高水平，主要由服务业推动——鉴于5月巴基斯坦/印度边境冲突导致机场关闭可能对旅游业造成的影响，这一结果令人意外。我们的经济学家评论称，鉴于GDP数据的显著上行惊喜，尽管美国关税相关因素对增长构成逆风，他们仍认为2025年和2026财年的实际GDP增速预测存在上行风险。

- Flows in India credit were more two-way this week – partly due to valuations in IG after the rip tighter post S&P’s upgrade and partly due to an increasing supply tape in HY (mostly in the NBFCs for now). At this juncture of valuations, while investors seem broadly comfortable with the macro-risks from the trade tensions (on the positive side, India has been making decent strides in improving relations with China to break down trade barriers there), the sector seems largely a carry play where
further compression will take longer to materialize in low/mid- beta.

本周印度信贷市场的资金流动更趋双向——部分原因是标普上调评级后投资级（IG）利差大幅收窄后的估值因素，部分原因是高收益（HY）市场供应增加（目前主要集中在非银行金融公司 NBFCs）。在当前估值水平下，尽管投资者整体上对贸易紧张局势带来的宏观风险感到较为安心（从积极的一面看，印度在改善与中国关系、打破贸易壁垒方面已取得了不错进展），但该板块整体上仍主要是一个利差持有的投资机会，低/中贝塔资产的进一步利差压缩可能需要更长时间才能实现。

- Touching base briefly on a couple of other thematics this week – there was significant underperformance in the EM IG sovereign sector as bonds failed to keep up with the move in core rates amidst tight valuations and very flat curves. Concerns over protests in Indonesia amplified a bit of the weakness on Friday with multiple down-prints in cash in the afternoon and buying of CDS from macro HFs/RMs. On a positive note, China HY was very busy – more so in mid-beta – retail/PB accounts were large buyers of front-end paper after the move lower in front-end yields. A positive overtone for the property sector in anticipation of more easing measures kept higher beta bonds well bid as China HY remains one of the last places with significant yield in Asia. Possibly stamping approval on the improving China sentiment, GLP was the beneficiary of a \(\) 1.5bn\(investment from ADIA and the perps gapped up to finish the week \~9.5pts higher while the 28s were next best mover on the curve to finish 4.5pts higher.

本周简要回顾其他几个主题——新兴市场投资级主权债板块表现明显落后，由于估值紧张且收益率曲线极为平坦，债券未能跟上核心利率的走势。印尼的抗议活动引发的担忧在周五进一步加剧了疲软，下午现券多次下跌，同时宏观对冲基金/资产管理机构买入了CDS。积极的一面是，中国高收益债市场非常活跃——尤其是中等贝塔品种——在前端收益率下行后，零售/私人银行账户大量买入前端债券。对房地产行业的积极预期以及更多宽松措施的预期，使得高贝塔债券需求旺盛，因为中国高收益债仍是亚洲少数几个仍有显著收益的领域之一。或许是对中国情绪改善的认可，GLP获得了来自ADIA的15亿美元投资，其永续债价格大幅跳涨，周末收高约9.5个点，而28年到期债券是曲线上表现第二好的品种，收高4.5个点。

- View wise, it is difficult to get overly constructive for a lot more compression given the expected supply tape globally in September. Asia credit markets are leaning to the expensive side driven by strong regional flows and a slow primary over the summer. Investors have firmly bought into the scenario of a Fed cut in September and are using that to stay well invested into year-end. Turnover of risk though is getting more difficult as the market doesn't want to overly buy credit at these levels but remain invested for the carry profile for the next 4 months. We think a steady grind remains possible and probably will gather steam if the market can navigate the September supply and the various geopolitical affairs currently at play. "Coasting"
is probably one word to describes the current state of the market.

is probably one word to describes the current state of the market.从观点来看，考虑到9月份全球预期的供应情况，要对进一步大幅压缩持过于乐观的态度是困难的。亚洲信贷市场由于强劲的区域资金流入以及夏季初级市场的放缓，正偏向于昂贵的—侧。投资者已经坚定地接受了美联储将在9月份降息的预期，并以此为依据在年底前保持较高的投资水平。然而，风险的周转变得更加困难，因为市场不愿在当前水平上大量买入信贷，但仍希望持有以获取未来4个月的利差收益。我们认为，稳步推进仍有可能，如果市场能够应对9月份的供应以及当前各种地缘政治事务，可能会进一步加速。“滑行”或许是形容当前市场状态的一个恰当词汇。
2. 亚洲每周风险动向 (Neel Dave)
[excerpt, full note here]

EM IG Sovereigns/Quasi- Sovereigns: Some material underperformance in the sector vs. broader Asia IG as bond prices failed to keep up with the rally in core rates. There was some pressure on spreads as RMs/HFs turned better sellers after Monday while local demand was predominantly in the front- end only. INDON underperformed on the week (particularly on Friday where spreads were 3- 5bps wider after protests in Jakarta escalated with violence reported) - front- end/belly bonds were 12- 15bps wider while the \(\sim 10yr\) part of the curve was 6- 9bps wider and long- end 4- 6bps wider. PHILIP was 10- 12bps wider across the front- end/belly, 6- 8bps wider around 8- 10yr tenors and 2- 4bps wider in the long- end. EM quasi- sovereigns saw slightly better selling from RMs given the recent outperformance in spreads vs. the sovereign. PERTIJ closed 6- 8bps wider across the curve while PLNIJ was 4- 6bps wider in the long- end and 10- 12bps wider in the belly. FRIDPT curve also saw a flattening bias with the 32s closing 12bps wider and 52s just 6bps wider while IDASAL was similarly 8- 10bps wider in the belly vs. 2- 4bps wider in the long- end.

China IG: Constructive week for the sector with flows turning more two- way across duration and low beta instead of the usual skew to onshore buying that we are so used to seeing after positive macro developments. TMT sector remained busy with TENCNT long- end outperforming to close 2- 4bps tighter (vs. BABA 10yr/long- end 2- 4bps wider). The belly (29s/30s) in both curves saw some onshore selling to close 1- 2bps wider. MEITUA underperformed after reporting challenging results with both the 29s/30s finishing the week 10- 12bps wider (28s were +8bps) on the back of global RM selling (although onshore buying stepped in on Friday). Other tickers in the sector like TME, JD, XIAOMI (upgraded to Baa1 from Baa2 by Moody's) and LENOVO were 1- 2bps tighter with WB lagging slightly (+2bps).

中国投资级债券：本周板块表现积极，资金流向在不同期限和低贝塔品种间更加双向流动，而非我们在宏观利好后常见的偏向于境内买盘的单边格局。TMT板块依然活跃，TENCNT长端表现优异，收窄2- 4个基点（相比之下，BABA10年期/长端走宽2- 4个基点）。两条曲线的中段（29年/30年）均出现部分境内卖盘，收盘走宽1- 2个基点。MEITUA在公布业绩承压后表现不佳，29年/30年全周走宽10- 12个基点（28年期走宽8个基点），主要受全球RM卖盘影响（尽管周五有境内买盘介入）。板块内其他个券如TME、JD、小米（穆迪评级由Baa2上调至Baa1）和联想均收窄1- 2个基点，而WB略微落后（+2个基点）。

HK IG: The sector saw pick- up in activity and actually tightened despite concerns on HIBOR moving higher. CPREIT was in focus after it was downgraded to HY but instead saw buying from HY- dedicated mandates and little forced selling from IG- mandates and thus ended the week 20bps tighter. NWDEVL curve was also better bid on better equity sentiment with the bullet 28s +2pts and 29s/30s +1.5pts while the perps were 1- 2pts higher depending on line. HYSAN 7.2% perps saw demand from RMs to close 0.875pts higher (- 5.5bps). FRESHK curve remained well bid and closed 0.125pts higher in the 27s and 0.25- 0.4pts higher in the 28s. In financials, FWDGHD 29s were active on two- way flows between RMs/HFs and closed 22bps wider on spread or 0.375pts lower on cash price. The rest of the curve (31s/33s) were 0.625- 0.75pts higher on cash price or 2bps wider on spread.

China Property: Strong week for the sector, perhaps riding on the optimism of the equity rally early in the week in some of the large cap developers (Vanke +9%, Longfor +5% on Monday) and accounts getting more comfortable with China front- end risk. Results still remain challenging for the property sector so real credit risk remains but at least capital markets are more willing to provide refinancing solutions for issuers to buy time. High beta tickers were 0.5- 0.75pts higher (e.g. SHUION 26s, GRNCH 28s and FUTLAN 28s) while FLTNHD 26s outperformed to close 1.25pts higher on regional fund demand. VNKRLE closed 0.125- 0.25pts higher with retail interest across both tranches while LNGFOR outperformed to close 1.0- 1.5pts higher with RM buyers.

中国房地产：本周板块表现强劲，或许受益于周初部分大型开发商股价上涨带来的乐观情绪（万科周一上涨9%，龙湖上涨5%），以及投资者对中国前端风险的接受度提升。尽管房地产行业的业绩依然面临挑战，真实的信用风险依旧存在，但至少资本市场更愿意为发行人提供再融资方案以争取时间。高贝塔债券上涨0.5- 0.75点（如SHUION26s、GRNCH28s和FUTLAN28s），而FLTNHD26s在区域基金需求推动下表现突出，上涨1.25点。VNKRLE在零售投资者对两个分期均有兴趣的带动下上涨0.125- 0.25点，而LNGFOR在RM买盘推动下表现优异，上涨1.0- 1.5点。

China Industrials: The main mover was GLP after receiving a \(1.5bn investment from ADIA to boost growth (with the initial outlay starting at\) 500mm). The perps jumped the most and finished the week \~9.5pts higher while the 28s were the next best mover on the curve to finish 4.5pts higher. GLPCHI 26s rallied 1.25pts as well. Other higher beta tickers like WESCHI (+1.75pts) and BTSDF (+1pt) performed well with HF/RM interest. In lower beta, FOSUNI curve was very active with sellers of the front- end 26s and two- way interest in the 27s/28s (the curve closed 0.75- 1pts higher in those tranches). In HK, LIFUNG 29s outperformed on RM/HF buying to close 1pt higher while the perps were 2.25pts higher.

中国工业板块：本周主要推动因素是GLP在获得来自ADIA的15亿美元投资以促进增长后（初始投入为5亿美元）。永续债涨幅最大，周末收高约9.5点，而28年期债券是曲线上表现第二好的品种，收高4.5点。GLPCHI 26年期债券也上涨了1.25点。其他高贝塔票息如WESCHI（+1.75点）和BTSDF（+1点）在对冲基金/零售市场的兴趣推动下表现良好。在低贝塔板块中，FOSUNI曲线交易非常活跃，26年期前端债券有卖盘，27年期和28年期则有双向交易兴趣（这些期限的曲线收高0.75- 1点）。在香港，LIFUNG 29年期债券在零售市场/对冲基金买盘推动下表现优异，收高1点，而永续债上涨了2.25点。

- India HY (Renewables/NBFCs/Others): Prices mostly held on to their gains but underperformed the move in core rates so left spreads wider on the week – given that move and some supply, there were some de-risking flows from RMs towards the end of the week. Renewables closed 0.125-0.25pts higher (between -10bps/+10bps) with higher duration tickers outperforming e.g. SAELLT 31s +0.5pts, HBSPIN 31s +0.625pts, ARENRJ 39s +0.5pts and CGRNEG 33s +1pt. NBFCs were busy as MUTHIN priced a \(600mm 4.5yr\) note (4yr WAL) at \(6.375\%\) yield - the new MUTHIN 30s closed the week \~0.15pts higher while the rest of the curve was very active on two-way flows between RMs (29s -0.5pts or 30bps wider, 28s unch). Other NBFCs were roughly flat (sector 10-15bps wider) with the recently issued IHLIN 28s struggling to rally despite an up-print at \(100 on Monday (closed at\) 99.50, +0.4pts from reoffer). SHFLIN 28s were the outperformer closing 0.3pts higher on RM demand while MGLIN 28s closed 0.3pts lower (25bps wider). Elsewhere, BIOLIN underperformed to close 0.375pts lower (30bps wider) on small-sized RM selling while VEDLN was marginally higher by 0.125-0.25pts (29s outperforming at +0.375pts). UPLLIN 30s saw some RM interest to close 0.2pts higher (12bps wider).
[excerpt, full note here]
In my view 2 parts are key that stood out and I think will be key in driving spreads/reaction function.
我认为有两个关键部分尤为突出，并且将成为推动利差/反应机制的关键因素。

- US IG/ calling for \(\) 175bn\(of supply for month of Sept; and color from US syndicate is will be front-loaded with not a ton of duration skewed to high quality. Issuers want in/out before FOMC. - MENA/ floodgates too - likes of Saudi Awwal Bank/BBB issuing 1.25bn 10NC5 T2 at decent spreads. - Asia EM/ c. \(\) 5bn\(of new issue printed last week (OCBC T2 at 3.7x cover with 35bps tightening/KDB 3yr EUR etc). And I'm still waiting for Andrew on his thoughts for Asia supply as he is busy with a few NDR including FWD that we are doing - Oh. Fubon is finally here and desk is seeing some SHIKON being lifted as c.201 levels by RM even with UST being out but generically a weaker open in TW lifer space. PTTGC/KYUSEL just announced too.
Still a net negative year for the region/so stay involved as absolute cash walls will stay firm.
对该地区来说今年仍是净负面/因此请继续参与，因为绝对现金壁垒将保持稳固。

I had a more peaceful August leave vs. last year so I' ll leave this as we navigate Sept. Again, SPX/NDX leads and rest of it will be reaction function as we also have a plethora of data heavy month with FOMC later. But credit guys we stay the course. Buy some protection if you need to. As the song goes, wake me up when Sept ends..
相比去年，我度过了一个更为平静的八月假期，所以在我们应对九月时我就先说到这里。再次强调，SPX/NDX领涨，其余市场将作为反应函数，同时我们还将迎来一个数据密集的月份，并在稍后迎来FOMC。但对于信贷领域，我们将坚持既定路线。如果需要，可以买些保护。正如歌曲所唱，“wake me up when September ends”
Source:BBG,asof \(1^{st}\) Sept2025 来源：BBG，截至2025年9月1日
CDXIG(Spread terms;green \(\equiv\) wider)
CDXIG（利差条款；绿色 \(\equiv\) 利差扩大）
Source:BBG,asof \(1^{st}\) Sept2025 来源：BBG，截至2025年9月1日
[excerpt, full note here]

- Defensive stance calls for shifting Asia HY preference to Greater China HY. Given how tight valuation is across Asia credit, we see current levels providing little cushion against negative surprises. Recent news suggests that uncertainties surrounding Indonesia and India have increased, and we believe a neutral stance on Indonesia and India HY is warranted, and are shifting our Asia HY preference to Greater China HY.
防御性立场促使我们将亚洲高收益偏好转向大中华区高收益。鉴于亚洲信贷整体估值已非常紧张，我们认为当前水平几乎无法为负面意外提供缓冲。近期消息显示，围绕印尼和印度的不确定性有所增加，我们认为对印尼和印度高收益债采取中性立场是合理的，并将亚洲高收益偏好转向大中华区高收益。

- Market focus shifting from "US Exceptionalism" to "De-Dollarization". Late last year, much of the market attention was tilted towards "US Exceptionalism", though our investor conversations indicate that "De-Dollarization" has become a much bigger theme.
市场关注点正从“美国例外论”转向“去美元化”。去年年底，市场关注的重点更多集中在“美国例外论”，但我们与投资者的交流显示，“去美元化”已成为一个更为重要的主题。

- USD credit still offers attractive yields. The USD-denominated bond market is by far the biggest and most liquid in the world, and offers yields above local currency bond yields from the larger Asian economies. Finding suitable domestic alternatives that offer yields similar to USD credit remains a challenge.
美元信贷仍然提供具有吸引力的收益率。以美元计价的债券市场迄今为止是全球规模最大、流动性最强的市场，其收益率高于亚洲主要经济体的本币债券收益率。寻找能够提供与美元信贷相似收益率的合适本土替代品仍是一项挑战。

- Local currency credit markets have room to grow, though USD bonds will continue to be important. Further "De-Dollarization" should provide ample opportunities for local currency credit markets to grow and develop, though we expect USD bonds will continue to be an important asset class for Asia credit investors for the foreseeable future.
本币信贷市场仍有增长空间，但美元债券将继续发挥重要作用。进一步的“去美元化”应为本币信贷市场的增长和发展提供充足机遇，但我们预计，在可预见的未来，美元债券仍将是亚洲信贷投资者的重要资产类别。
